question: Is CAT B Take-Off and Landing with tail wind permitted?
explanation: CAT B Take-Off and Landing with tail wind is prohibited.
references: CATEGORY B OPERATION LIMITATIONS (>9 passenger seats)

question: What electrical load does “75%” mean in CAT B WAT charts?
options: An electrical load of 75% on each DC generator
75% of total system load across all buses
answer: An electrical load of 75% on each DC generator
explanation: In CAT B WAT charts, 75% means that an electrical load of 75% on each DC generator has been included.
references: CATEGORY B OPERATION LIMITATIONS (>9 passenger seats)

question: What electrical load does “25%” mean in CAT B WAT charts?
options: An electrical load of 25% on each DC generator
25% of total system load across all buses
answer: An electrical load of 25% on each DC generator
explanation: In CAT B WAT charts, 25% means that an electrical load of 25% on each DC generator has been included.
references: CATEGORY B OPERATION LIMITATIONS (>9 passenger seats)

question: At what altitude can a safe vertical reject be carried out up to 15 ft for weight up to 4600 kg?
answer: Up to 15 ft for weight up to 4600 kg (valid up to 4600 kg)
explanation: A safe vertical reject can always be carried out from HIGE up to 15 ft for weight up to 4600 kg.
references: CATEGORY B OPERATION LIMITATIONS (>9 passenger seats)

question: At what altitude can a safe vertical reject be carried out up to 15 ft for weight in excess of 4600 kg up to 4800 kg?
explanation: A safe vertical reject can always be carried out from HIGE up to 15 ft for weight in excess of 4600 kg up to 4800 kg up to 5000 ft.
references: CATEGORY B OPERATION LIMITATIONS (>9 passenger seats)

question: At what altitude can a safe vertical reject be carried out up to 10 ft for weight in excess of 4600 kg up to 4800 kg?
explanation: A safe vertical reject can always be carried out from HIGE up to 10 ft for weight in excess of 4600 kg up to 4800 kg up to 10,000 ft.
references: CATEGORY B OPERATION LIMITATIONS (>9 passenger seats)
